attributes.name: Tour
attributes.description:
Interaction with ember-shepherd is done entirely through the Tour service, which you can access from any object using the Ember.inject syntax:

import Component from '@ember/component';
import { inject as service } from '@ember/service';

export default Component.extend({

  tour: service()

  // OR

  tourService: service('tour')
});

The following configuration options can be set on the Tour service to control the way that Shepherd is used. The only required option is steps, which is set via addSteps.

fields.name: confirmCancel
fields.description: confirmCancel is a boolean flag, when set to true it will pop up a native browser confirm window on cancel, to ensure you want to cancel.

fields.name: confirmCancelMessage
fields.description: confirmCancelMessage is a string to display in the confirm dialog when confirmCancel is set to true.

fields.name: defaultStepOptions
fields.description:
defaultStepOptions is used to set the options that will be applied to each step by default. You can pass in any of the options that you can with Shepherd.

⚠️ You must set defaultStepOptions BEFORE calling addSteps to set the steps.

It will be an object of a form something like:

this.get('tour').set('defaultStepOptions', {
  classes: 'custom-class-name-1 custom-class-name-2',
  scrollTo: true,
  cancelIcon: {
    enabled: true
  },
});

default value: {}

fields.name: disableScroll
fields.description:
disableScroll is a boolean, that when set to true, will keep the user from scrolling with the scrollbar, mousewheel, arrow keys, etc. You may want to use this to ensure you are driving the scroll position with the tour.

default value: false

fields.name: modal
fields.description:
modal is a boolean, that should be set to true, if you would like the rest of the screen, other than the current element, greyed out, and the current element highlighted. If you do not need modal functionality, you can remove this option or set it to false.

default value: false

fields.name: requiredElements
fields.description:
requiredElements is an array of objects that indicate DOM elements that are REQUIRED by your tour and must exist and be visible for the tour to start. If any elements are not present, it will keep the tour from starting.

You can also specify a message, which will tell the user what they need to do to make the tour work.

⚠️ You must set requiredElements BEFORE calling addSteps to set the steps.

Example

this.get('tour').set('requiredElements', [
  {
    selector: '.search-result-element',
    message: 'No search results found. Please execute another search, and try to start the tour again.',
    title: 'No results'
  },
  {
    selector: '.username-element',
    message: 'User not logged in, please log in to start this tour.',
    title: 'Please login'
  },
]);

default value: []

fields.name: styleVariables
fields.description: styleVariables allows you to override the default Shepherd styles.

methods.name: addSteps
methods.description:
Take a set of steps, create a tour object based on the current configuration and load the shepherd.js dependency. This method returns a promise which resolves when the shepherd.js dependency has been loaded and shepherd is ready to use.

You must pass an array of steps to addSteps, something like this:

this.get('tour').addSteps([
  {
    attachTo: {
      element:'.first-element',
      on: 'bottom'
    },
    beforeShowPromise: function() {
      return new Promise(function(resolve) {
        Ember.run.scheduleOnce('afterRender', this, function() {
          window.scrollTo(0, 0);
          this.get('documents.firstObject').set('isSelected', true);
          resolve();
        });
      });
    },
    buttons: [
      {
        classes: 'shepherd-button-secondary',
        text: 'Exit',
        type: 'cancel'
      },
      {
        classes: 'shepherd-button-primary',
        text: 'Back',
        type: 'back'
      },
      {
        classes: 'shepherd-button-primary',
        text: 'Next',
        type: 'next'
      }
    ],
    cancelIcon: {
      enabled: true
    },
    classes: 'custom-class-name-1 custom-class-name-2',
    highlightClass: 'highlight',
    id: 'intro',
    scrollTo: false,
    title: 'Welcome to Ember-Shepherd!',
    text: 'Ember-Shepherd is a JavaScript library for guiding users through your Ember app.',
    when: {
      show: () => {
        console.log('show step');
      },
      hide: () => {
        console.log('hide step');
      }
    }
  },
...
]);

returns.description: Promise that resolves when everything has been set up and shepherd is ready to use

methods.name: back
methods.description: Get the tour object and call back

methods.name: next
methods.description: Advance the tour to the next step and trigger next

methods.name: show
methods.description: Show a specific step, by passing its id

params.name: id
params.description: The id of the step you want to show

methods.name: start
methods.description: Start the tour. The Promise from addSteps() must be in a resolved state prior to starting the tour!

methods.name: _onTourStart
methods.description: When the tour starts, setup the step event listeners, and disableScroll

methods.name: _onTourFinish
methods.description: This function is called when a tour is completed or cancelled to initiate cleanup.

methods.name: _initialize
methods.description: Initializes the tour, creates a new Shepherd.Tour. sets options, and binds events

methods.name: _requiredElementsPresent
methods.description: Observes the array of requiredElements, which are the elements that must be present at the start of the tour, and determines if they exist, and are visible, if either is false, it will stop the tour from executing.

functions.name: makeButton
functions.description: Creates a button of the specified type, with the given classes and text

params.name: button.type
params.description: The type of button cancel, back, or next

params.name: button.classes
params.description: Classes to apply to the button

functions.name: elementIsHidden
functions.description: Helper method to check if element is hidden, since we cannot use :visible without jQuery

params.name: element
params.description: The element to check for visibility
